examples.text: * bleep whistle whistle whirr whistle bloop beep *
* bleep beep boop whistle whirr whistle *
* whirr bloop boop whistle whirr bleep *

senses.synonym: 07414517-n (sound of something in rapid motion; \""whir of a bird's wings\""; \""the whir of the propellers\"");01054434-v (make a vibrant sound, as of some birds);02193033-v (make a soft swishing sound; \""the motor whirred\""; \""the car engine purred\""

relations.target: motion=00280679-n (the act of changing location from one place to another; \""police controlled the motion of the crowd\""; \""the movement of people from the farms to the cities\""; \""his move put him directly in my path\"");00332776-n (a change of position that does not entail a change of location; \""the reflex motion of his eyebrows revealed his surprise\""; \""movement is a sign of life\""; \""an impatient move of his hand\""; \""gastrointestinal motility\"");06889359-n (the use of movements (especially of the hands) to communicate familiar or prearranged signals);07178244-n (a formal proposal for action made to a deliberative assembly for discussion and vote; \""he made a motion to adjourn\""; \""she called for the question\"");07324399-n (a natural event that involves a change in the position or location of something);11445202-n (an optical illusion of motion produced by viewing a rapid succession of still pictures of a moving object; \""the cinema relies on apparent motion\""; \""the succession of flashing lights gave an illusion of movement\"");14027802-n (a state of change; \""they were in a state of steady motion\"");00994073-v (show, express or direct through movement; \""He gestured his desire to leave\""

rapid=00982888-a (done or occurring in a brief period of time; \""a rapid rise through the ranks\"");00983053-a (characterized by speed; moving with or capable of moving with high speed; \""a rapid movement\""; \""a speedy car\""; \""a speedy errand boy\"");09428274-n (a part of a river where the current is very fast

vibration=00346752-n (the act of vibrating);04735141-n (a distinctive emotional aura experienced instinctively; \""that place gave me bad vibrations\""; \""it gave me a nostalgic vibe\"");07359766-n ((physics) a regular periodic variation in value about a mean);14028057-n (a shaky motion; \""the shaking of his fingers as he lit his pipe\""

buzz=01262688-n (a confusion of activity and gossip; \""the buzz of excitement was so great that a formal denial was issued\"");07392834-n (sound of rapid vibration; \""the buzz of a bumble bee\"");00793966-v (call with a buzzer; \""he buzzed the servant\"");01928220-v (fly low; \""Planes buzzed the crowds in the square\"");02186555-v (make a buzzing sound; \""bees were buzzing around the hive\"");02712465-v (be noisy with activity; \""This office is buzzing with activity\""

senses.definition: A sibilant buzz or vibration; the sound of something in rapid motion.
